result.execSummary:
The defendant Laron J Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Laron J Smith is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Laron J Smith was found guilty of Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money [Modifiers: PTAC], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).
  • Laron J Smith was found guilty of Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money [Modifiers: PTAC], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Each ct concur.
8/19/16 Crt extends Def's probation for 1 yr from 8/21/16 to 8/21/17 or until the completion of treatment & all court obligations have been paid.

miscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge remitted. $278  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervison or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
Maintain full-time employment/education or combination of or be seeking same, and treatment.  Obtain GED or high school diploma or equivalency.
Court finds defendant eligible for expunction under 973.015 no ATR, no new charges rising to the level of probable cause & get his GED.
Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.
$268  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.
All other conditions are the same as count 14.
